pgTitle: List of World War II films 1950–1989

rows.text: Thriller. Disabled veteran tries to deliver a medal
British, Dutch and French POWs in special "escape-proof" castle prison
Drama. End of war for German soldiers; second of three parts
Drama. End of war for German soldiers; third of three parts
Ernst Thälmann – Leader of his Class
Hitler: The Last Ten Days (The Last Act)
Musical comedy-drama. US soldiers vowing to reunite after war in 1955
The Battle of the River Plate
Biruma no tategoto (ビルマの竪琴)
Romance/Drama. British homefront and ballerina falling for American soldier sent to France, 1944
Un condamné à mort s'est échappé ou Le vent souffle où il veut
Comedy. Reluctantly conscripted/commissioned soldier and art heist behind German lines
African-American pilot down behind enemy lines rescues two orphans
Crime thriller. Allied pilot captured and tortured by Nazis and postwar search for his betrayer
The Bridge on the River Kwai
Comedy. US Navy pilots on leave in San Francisco
Comedy-romance. Closing of US Army hospital in France at end of war
Polish resistance spies on German rocket tests
British and Dutch POWs in Malaya
Drama based on true story. Chinese agents in Japanese-held Shanghai, 1939
Comedy-romance. Escaped American POW hiding in Berlin near end of war
Comedy. US Army Sergeant impersonating fallen general to inspire comrades in France
Drama. US Marines on shore leave in San Francisco before returning to battle
The Inn of the Sixth Happiness
English missionary in China during Sino-Japanese War
British commandos on mission to occupied Holland find fortune in Nazi diamonds
Drama. Soldiers sent to destroy base and strategic documents in occupied Philippines; remade as 1968 film Hell Raiders
A Time to Love and a Time to Die
Action-drama. Three soldiers during war: one German, two American (one Jewish)
As Far as My Feet Will Carry Me (TV miniseries)
Poetic drama. Soldier receives home leave as reward for heroism
Action-drama. Submarine on reconnaissance photographing Japanese installations through periscope
Allied escape from POW camp in Northern Italy, Summer 1943
Hiroshima mon amour (French) Nijuuyojikan no jouji (Japanese)
The Human Condition: No Greater Love
Ningen no jōken I (人間の條件)
The Human Condition: Road to Eternity
Ningen no jōken II (人間の條件)
Imperial Japanese Army basic training; part two of trilogy
US Army paratroopers in North Africa, Sicily, and Italy
Comedy. British council workmen drafted into service in France and mistaken for spies by Nazis
Stalingrad: Dogs, Do You Want to Live Forever? (Battle Inferno)
Drama. US ammo and demolition unit on reconnaissance mission to determine where Germans ford river
